author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
The bitterly fought Bihar Assembly polls seem to have been put behind as Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar shared the stage and compliments at Hajipur on Saturday.

Mr Kumar made the first move, complime-nting Mr Modi while addressing the crowd. “After the Assembly poll, you have come to Bihar for the first time but I’ll request you to visit the State again and again for its develop-ment,” he said. And then it was the Mr. Modi’s turn to return the compliment when he said Bihar had been neglected in the last 10 years but things had moved in the last 18 months. “This project was initiated when Nitishji was Railway Minister and Atalji was the Prime Minister…the dream project of Nitish is being realised today.”
title: Nitish, Modi break the ice
